conclusion: Calculate gravitational force exerted by remaining part of sphere on point mass m after smaller sphere is removed using principle of superposition and gravitational force concept.
Original sphere has mass M and radius R; point mass m is located at distance 2R from center O of sphere.
Gravitational force F0 between original sphere and point mass m is F0 = G Mm / 4R^2.
Volume of removed sphere is V_removed = 1/6 π R^3.
Volume of original sphere is V_original = 4/3 π R^3.
Mass of removed sphere M_removed is M_removed = 1/8 M.
Center of removed sphere is at distance 3R/2 from point mass m.
Gravitational force F_removed due to removed sphere is F_removed = G Mm / 18R^2.
Net gravitational force F is difference between initial force and force due to removed sphere: F = F0 - F_removed.
Simplified expression for net gravitational force: F = G Mm / 4R^2 (3.5/4.5).
Further simplification of net gravitational force: F = G 7Mm / 36R^2.
Final gravitational force F exerted by remaining part of sphere on point mass m is F = 7/36 G Mm / R^2.
